contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2012}} The '''Xeelee Sequence''' is a series of novels and short stories by [[United Kingdom|British]] [[science fiction]] author [[Stephen Baxter]]. The novels span several billions of years<!-- I say billions, not millions- chronologically, Michael Poole at least travels/exists several billions/trillions/whatever-large periods of time.-->, describing the future expansion of Mankind, its war with its arch-nemesis (an alien race called the [[Xeelee]]), and the Xeelee's own war with [[dark matter]] entities called photino birds. Other important [[Xeelee Sequence species]] include the [[Qax (species)|Qax]] and the Silver Ghosts. Several novels also deal with humans and posthumans living in extreme conditions, such as the heart of a [[neutron star]] (''[[Flux (novel)|Flux]]'') or a universe with considerably stronger [[gravity]] (''[[Raft (novel)|Raft]]''). Baxter's ''[[Destiny's Children]]'' series is part of this series. When asked directly for a suggested reading order, the author wrote: "I hope that all the books and indeed the stories can be read stand-alone. I’m not a great fan of books that end with cliff-hangers. So you could go in anywhere. One way would be to start with ‘Vacuum Diagrams’, a collection that sets out the overall story of the universe. Then ‘Timelike Infinity’ and ‘Ring’ which tell the story of Michael Poole, then ‘Raft’ and ‘Flux’ which are really incidents against the wider background, and finally ‘Destiny’s Children.’"<ref>http://www.themanifold.co.uk/interview.php</ref> An omnibus edition of the first four Xeelee novels; Raft, Timelike Infinity, Flux and Ring, was released in January 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stephen-baxter.com/books.html#xee |title=Books |publisher=Stephen Baxter |date= |accessdate=1 March 2012}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== *[[Great Attractor]] ==External links== * Baxter's own complete (as of July 2009) [http://www.stephen-baxter.com/articles.html timeline for the Xeelee Sequence] of novels and stories, hosted on his official website. {{Stephen Baxter}} [[Category:Stephen Baxter series]] [[Category:Xeelee sequence| ]]
